document_data.caption: Travelers in the plane of Pandemonium.
document_data.name: Pandemonium
document_data.gravity-GW: Objective Directional: away from the center of passages and caverns
document_data.magical-GW: Normal, but sound-based spells have very limited range

Description.Cocytus:
{{Main|Cocytus}}
The second layer was called the layer of lamentation because the wind whistling through the tunnels carried the cries of anguish and the sounds of sorrow. The passages on this level were narrower making the noise shrill enough to drive ''insane'' anyone with unprotected hearing. Unlike the natural looking tunnels and caves of Pandesmos, the passages of Cocytus were carved by beings unknown to even the gods.
Description.Phlegethon:
{{Main|Phlegethon}}
The third layer was the layer of dark and damp. The walls were matte black and absorbed all light with no reflection—all light sources could only illuminate half as far as normal. Many rivers and streams cut through the black rock and the constant dripping of eons built up stalactites, stalagmites, and other cave formations.
Description.Agathion:
{{Main|Agathion (layer)}}
Agathion ({{Pronounce|a|GAY|thee|on|refs={{Cite dragon/93/Ay pronunseeAYshun gyd|25}}}}) was the deepest known layer of Pandemonium and was made of solid rock with no tunnels and only giant spherical bubbles of air or vacuum. Those bubbles with a barrier to Phlegethon were filled with huge windstorms capable of flinging even large humanoids around. Pockets without a connection to the next level were often the final resting places of things that should not be awakened.

document_data.Inhabitants:
[[File:pandemonium-4e.jpg|thumb|250px|''An adventurer braving the wind in Pandemonium.'']]
Pandemonium had no known indigenous life forms but many inhabitants that were either immigrants, visitors, exiles, marooned, or prisoners. [[Quasit]]s and [[shadow demon]]s were plentiful, as well as many low- to mid-level [[demon]]s and the occasional [[demon lord]]-in-exile.
document_data.Afterlife:
{{Main|Afterlife}}
Only the spirits of the most merciless [[bugbear]]s traveled to Pandemonium after death.
document_data.Realms:
* [[Talos]] the Destroyer had a realm here.
* [[Auril]] the Frostmaiden's palace and realm of [[Winter's Hall]] was located in Pandemonium.
* [[Ibrandul]], the Lord of the Dry Depths, called the caverns of Phlegethon—or more specifically, his realm of  ''Ibrandyllaran''—home until he was slain during the [[Godswar]] by [[Shar]], deep within [[Undermountain]] where his remains were left petrified.
* [[Cyric]], the Black Sun, moved his realm, the [[Shattered Castle]] (though he called it "The Castle of the Supreme Throne"), to Pandemonium after residing in [[Hades]] before.<ref>
* [[Garagos]], the Reaver, kept his realm of [[Battle Garde]] on Cocytus.<ref>
* [[Gorellik]], the abandoned god of the [[gnoll]]s, spent much of his time wandering Pandemonium.<ref>
* [[Hruggek]] the god of bugbears had a great fortress named [[Hruggekolohk]] decorated with grisly trophies of those who trespassed.<ref> 
* ''[[Hidden Betrayal]]'' was the realm in Phlegethon of the [[derro]] god [[Diirinka]].<ref>
* [[Kar'r'rga]], the Dread God of the [[sartani]] resided here.<ref>
* [[Task]] the Taker and Holder, [[Draconic pantheon|dragon god]] of greed, had his enormous hoard on Pandemonium.<ref><ref>
